image.altText: A man wearing dark glasses walking outdoors with his head bowed.

props.synopsis: Chris Dawson is serving a maximum 24-year jail sentence for the murder of his first wife, Lynette Simms, more than four decades ago.

title.children: Former Sydney teacher Chris Dawson loses appeal over conviction for murdering wife

image.altText: A courtroom sketch of Greg Lynn

props.synopsis: Judge Michael Croucher tells the jury that the only charges to be considered are the alleged murders of two Victorian campers, Carol Clay and Russell Hill.

title.children: Judge says deaths of Carol Clay and Russell Hill cannot be ruled manslaughter in Greg Lynn trial

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: A study ranking nearly 100 cities in eight countries places Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide and Perth among the world's least affordable cities to buy a home.

title.children: Housing is 'impossibly unaffordable' in Sydney, Melbourne and Adelaide, and 'severely unaffordable' elsewhere

image.altText: A man holding a beer wearing a flower hat

props.synopsis: Seven women read their victim impact statements out in court after Andrew Thomas Hayler uploaded digitally altered photographs of them to sexually explicit websites.

title.children: Bartender who uploaded altered photos of friends to porn websites faces victims in Sydney court

image.altText: Melbourne chiropractor Ian Rossborough cracks a baby's back

props.synopsis: Doctors says the return of chiropractic practices on children is "deeply disturbing", after outcry over the practice led to an interim ban in 2019.

title.children: 'A shiver goes down my spine': Doctors group condemns return of practice of manipulating baby's spines

image.altText: A photo of saltwater crocodile is moved into police UTE.

props.synopsis: A saltwater crocodile almost 4 metres long seen stalking residents and dogs in the remote Northern Territory has been removed from a waterway in the territory's west.

title.children: 'A few full bellies': Large saltwater croc shot in Top End river, cooked in community feast

image.altText: A centrelink sign with on a building with a reflection

props.synopsis: An independent inquiry has been launched into why the National Anti-Corruption Commission decided against further investigation of the Robodebt scandal.

title.children: Inquiry launched into why anti-corruption commission decided against further scrutiny of robodebt scandal

image.altText: A group of graduates.

props.synopsis: Migration added just over 100,000 people to Australia's population in the last three months of 2023, according to new official figures that cast doubt on the government's own migration forecast.

title.children: Migration numbers drop a little but not as much as the government expected

image.altText: Svalbard entrance

props.synopsis: A team of scientists on the front lines of climate change are helping nature heal itself. But as wars rage around them, it's making their efforts to feed an increasingly hungry globe that much harder.

title.children: Deep inside the permafrost lies a doomsday vault holding the seeds of humanity. Only one person has taken them out

image.altText: NSW Police

props.synopsis: A 92-year-old man suffered a fracture to his right elbow, and significant bruising to his head and arms after police attended a home in Picton following reports of a domestic incident.

title.children: Two police officers charged with assault after 92yo man injured at home in south-west Sydney

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, wearing a suit and glasses, looking serious.

props.synopsis: The prime minister says it is "common sense" for the Victorian CFMEU boss to drop his threats against the AFL over chief umpire Stephen McBurney, the former head of the Australian Building and Construction Commission.

title.children: Albanese tells Setka to drop AFL war, as the Coalition accuses the PM of weakness

image.altText: Catherine Laga'aia

props.synopsis: Sydney teenager Catherine Laga'aia has been cast as Moana in a live-action remake of the Disney film. Laga'aia says she's excited and honoured to "represent young girls who look like me".

title.children: Who is the Australian teenager cast in the live-action Moana?

image.altText: Christian Petracca grimaces and holds his ribs as he his led by the arm off the field by a Melbourne Demons trainer.

props.synopsis: Melbourne's difficult season continues, with Demons star Christian Petracca confirming he will not play again this year after his injuries in the King's Birthday game against Collingwood.

title.children: Season over for Melbourne star Christian Petracca

image.altText: Emily Seebohm stands in front of a bright light

props.synopsis: Emily Seebohm says she wants to show that it's possible for new mums to achieve their dreams after becoming mothers.

title.children: Emily Seebohm aims to prove 'it's possible to not only have kids but achieve your dreams too'

image.altText: Blurred photo of an older man wearing red and black cap and check shirt stands near a near trophy board. Slight smile.

props.synopsis: Douglas Thrift died from strychnine toxicity, but a coroner has found there is not enough evidence to prove how he ingested the poison.

title.children: Mystery remains as coroner unable to determine how farmer consumed poison that killed him

image.altText: Leeanne Eatts walks past a camera wearing reflective sunglasses.

props.synopsis: A mother found guilty of manslaughter over the drowning deaths of her two "defenceless and vulnerable" young sons is sentenced to eight years' jail.

title.children: Mother sentenced to jail for sons' drowning deaths told she 'failed her duty as a parent'

image.altText: A bag of Korean instant noodles.

props.synopsis: Denmark's food agency recalls South Korean instant ramen produced by a brand popular in the West, warning noodle lovers that they are so hot they might cause "acute poisoning".

title.children: Denmark bans popular South Korean instant noodle for being too spicy

image.altText: Rose Byrne Ruby the Roo

props.synopsis: Tourism Australia is told a corruption investigation would not be launched, hours after the agency’s CEO refused to answer questions about the $137,000 incident.

title.children: Anti-corruption watchdog drops potential probe into Tourism Australia travel scandal

image.altText: Signage on a shop front with a red house silhouette that reads Chemist Warehouse.

props.synopsis: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission says a proposed merger between pharmacy retail giant Chemist Warehouse and Sigma Healthcare raises "competition concerns" in the country's pharmacy sector.

title.children: ACCC warns Chemist Warehouse's $8.8 billion merger could lead to higher prices and less competition

image.altText: A close up shot of a police officer with red eyes

props.synopsis: WA police officers are recognised for their response to a fatal shooting that locked down a small town and sent local police into overdrive.

title.children: 'Active shooter' were the two words that sent this tiny police station into overdrive

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian stocks are trading higher on Thursday, following a rally on Wall Street after softer US inflation data. Meanwhile, Australia's unemployment rate has fallen slightly to 4 per cent in May. Follow live.

title.children: 'Labour market remains relatively tight' as unemployment rate falls, local shares pushing higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Pharmacy Guild shares ACCC's concerns over Chemist Warehouse merger
Expect the RBA to stay in wait-and-see mode, analysts say
What does the Chemist Warehouse and Sigma merger mean?

image.altText: A screenshot of a job search website.

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate declines to 4 per cent in May, from 4.1 per cent in April. Is it a 'goldilocks' scenario for the Reserve Bank?

title.children: Australia's unemployment rate declines to 4 per cent in May, presenting a 'goldilocks' scenario for Reserve Bank

image.altText: A man, Brett Button, standing in a crowd of people with news cameras surrounding him

props.synopsis: Special court provisions will be needed for the sentencing of Hunter bus crash driver Brett Andrew Button, given the number of victims and families expected to attend.

title.children: Judge rules Hunter Valley bus crash driver must be in court to hear 35 victim impact statements

image.altText: A composite picture of two women and a man, all looking serious.

props.synopsis: Senators from across the political spectrum have agreed the public service is over-reliant on consultants, but they are not in perfect agreement on the way forward.

title.children: Three senators have exposed Canberra's 'vicious' consultant problem. But don't expect change overnight

image.altText: A brown six-storey building with some parts charred by a fire. There is a red car and other white cars parked around.

props.synopsis: Kuwaiti's deputy prime minister pre-emptively blames the "greed of real estate owners" for the fire, which killed dozens of foreign workers in an accommodation block.

title.children: At least 49 foreign workers killed in Kuwait building fire

image.altText: An older woman walks down a crowded aisle at a grocery store.

props.synopsis: A single person out of work and living in a shared house has an average of just $127 left each week for bills or incidental expenses after covering rent, transport and food, the report finds, while a single-parent household on the Parenting Payment has just $24 remaining each week.

title.children: 'Never been harder': Job seekers are barely scraping by, Anglicare Australia says in annual cost-of-living report

image.altText: Close up of Peter Dutton in glasses.

props.synopsis: Two years ago, few would have thought Peter Dutton would go to the next election without a 2030 climate target. So what's changed?

title.children: Captain's call or press conference slip-up? Dutton's 2030 climate target U-turn surprised even his colleagues

image.altText: A man wearing a black t-shirt and baseball cap hugs his dog

props.synopsis: Tobias Sahlstorfer has been jailed for at least 23 years for the "tragic, brutal and totally unnecessary" bashing murder of Mark Boyce in January 2017.

title.children: Hells Angels bikie sentenced to life in prison over bashing murder of 'innocent bystander'

image.altText: An a lone emu looks down the barrel of the camera.

props.synopsis: Ruby Buchanan was getting ready to take her dogs for a walk when she and a friend were "fully charged" by four emus outside Broken Hill. A ranger says the large flightless birds can attack around this time of year as chicks mature.

title.children: Dog walker set upon by pack of territorial emus in startling but 'very funny' confrontation

image.altText: A sign in Coober Pedy in South Australia's outback that says

props.synopsis: Police have arrested two men after hundreds of thousands of dollars of opals were allegedly stolen from a business in the outback opal mining town of Coober Pedy.

title.children: Men arrested over alleged opal heist at Coober Pedy

image.altText: Bear breaks in to car in Canada

props.synopsis: An Ontario woman is left with a hefty repair bill after a bear breaks into her car, rips the upholstery apart, and then falls asleep.

title.children: Wild black bear takes 'revenge' against Canadian car owner

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing a cap smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: NSW Police are appealing for information about the suspicious death of surfer, Guy Haymes. Mr Haymes was assaulted inside a Manly unit in February of this year and later died in hospital.

title.children: 'We can't imagine anyone would want to hurt him': Police appeal after surfer bashed to death in Sydney

image.altText: A young woman wearing a blue nurse's uniform smiles while holding up a babygrow

props.synopsis: British nurse Lucy Letby, who was jailed last year for murdering seven babies and trying to kill six others, is on trial accused of the attempted murder of another baby in her care.

title.children: British serial killer Lucy Letby on trial accused of murdering baby girl

image.altText: A smiling woman in cold weather gear sits in front of a large ship, surrounded by snow.

props.synopsis: A survey of women who have done field work in the Arctic and Antarctic has found 79 per cent had a negative experience. The report's authors say "broad cultural and institutional changes" are needed.

title.children: Women working in polar areas 'basically half naked to go to the toilet', a report into field work conditions finds
